body_html:
@samjabrahams Yes. As you say.

The following code:

#include <iostream>
#include <stdint.h>

void record_host_persistent_memory_allocation(int64_t size) {
	std::cout << size << std::endl;
}
int main() {
	size_t a = 3;
	record_host_persistent_memory_allocation(-a);
	return 0;
}

output is "4294967293" on 32 bits build and "-3" on 64 bits build.
